{"step_by_step_thinking": "Indirect wax patterns are used in dentistry for the fabrication of restorations. Ivory wax, modeling wax, and inlay wax are all types of dental waxes used for this purpose. Ivory wax is used for its hardness and stability, modeling wax is used for its malleability and ease of use, and inlay wax is used for its ability to accurately reproduce fine details. Utility wax, on the other hand, is used for adjusting the edges of dental impressions and is not used for making indirect wax patterns.", "answer_choice": "C. Utility wax"}
